intro: Aster perezii, commonly known as the Mexican aster, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy purple to pink flowers. Aster perezii thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
